p: The antibacterial MIC values of evaluated plant extracts are presented in Table 1. The extracts were classified as having significant (MIC ≤ 0.1 mg/mL), moderate (0.1 < MIC ≤ 0.625 mg/mL) or weak (MIC > 0.625 mg/mL) antibacterial properties [ 24]. All aqueous extracts yielded MIC values >2.5 mg/mL ( Table S1). Generally, the evaluated plant parts demonstrated moderate antibacterial properties with MIC values ranging from 0.3–0.6 mg/mL. Interestingly, extracts from the seed (MeOH and petroleum ether) and twigs (MeOH) demonstrated noteworthy antibacterial activities against Gram-negative bacterial strains ( Escherichia coli and Klebsiella pneumonia). It was also worth noting that the methanolic leaf and twig extracts of the plant demonstrated promising bacteriostatic properties (MIC = 0.63 mg/mL) against the penicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus. However, the other drug-resistant bacterial strains were not susceptible to the plant extracts (MIC > 2.5 mg/mL) and hence were excluded from Table 1.
